metadata.title: CVE-2022-48337 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
GNU Emacs through 28.2 allows attackers to execute commands via shellmetacharacters in the name of a source-code file, because lib-src/etags.cuses the system C library function in its implementation of the etagsprogram. For example, a victim may use the "etags -u *" command (suggestedin the etags documentation) in a situation where the current workingdirectory has contents that depend on untrusted input.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48337` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

emacs - 1:27.1+1-3ubuntu5.2
emacs-bin-common - 1:27.1+1-3ubuntu5.2
emacs-common - 1:27.1+1-3ubuntu5.2
emacs-el - 1:27.1+1-3ubuntu5.2
emacs-gtk - 1:27.1+1-3ubuntu5.2
emacs-lucid - 1:27.1+1-3ubuntu5.2
emacs-nox - 1:27.1+1-3ubuntu5.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: emacs package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:27.1+1-3ubuntu5.2').
xemacs21 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
xemacs21-packages package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
